general_advisory: Keep your crop field free from weed to minimize the incidence of diseases and pests. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to cropâ€™s growth stage. Install yellow sticky traps to monitor sucking pests like White fly, Aphids, Jassids & Thirps in vegetables at vegetative stage.

advisory: Weed Management: Apply granular herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl 0.6% at 3-5 days after transplanting.
Harvest when 2/3rd to 3/4th of the pods have changed to brown color.
Sun dry harvested plant for 3-5 days.
Thresh seeds by beating pods with a stick or using Pullman thresher.
Weed Management: Apply Quizalfop-ethyl 5% EC or Imazethapyr 10 SL at 20-25 DAS.
Pest Management: Spray Profenophos 50 EC for leaf eating caterpillar.
Pest Management: If Tikka symptoms are noticed, apply Chlorothalonil 75% WP or Hexaconazole 5% EC or Mancozeb 75% WP.
Pest Management: Apply Metalaxyl M 4% + Mancozeb 64% WP or Copper Oxychloride 50% WP for White rust.
Pest Management: Need-based spray of Acetamiprid 20% SP or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL for Sucking pest complex (Aphid, Hopper, Thrips & White fly).
Powdery mildew: Spray 0.2% wettable sulphur.
Capitulum Borer: Spray Bacillus thuringiensis var kurstaki 5% WP.
Head Rot: Spray 0.4% Copper oxychloride 50% WP.
Irrigate the crop at regular intervals.
Undertake hoeing, weeding, and 1st top dressing with 45 kg urea at 4-week stage.
Nutrient Management: Apply 27 kg urea + 25kg MOP at six-to-seven-week stage.
Pest Management: Spray Fipronil 5% SC or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC for various pests.
Nutrient Management: Apply 27 kg urea at six-week stage.
Pest Management: Spray Mancozeb 75% WP for wilting symptoms.
Fruit & Shoot borer: Install pheromone trap to monitor pest population.
Pest Management: Apply Ethion 50% EC or Propargite 57% EC for mite infestation.
Increase concentrate in the feed gradually before two months prior to calving to improve milk production.
Prevent animals from chill wind and floor to avoid sickness. Contact veterinarians if symptoms like running nose and cough are noticed.
Protect poultry birds from severe chill wind and cold floor to prevent mortality.
Cover poultry house with thick polythene sheet to protect from cold wind.
Care for litter material on the floor to keep birds warm.
